alert.note: Alert for Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued July 28 at 7:46PM MDT until July 28 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall possible through this evening. * WHERE...East Troublesome, Cameron Peak, Mullen, and Calwood burn scars. The main threats would be for the Mullen and the Cameron Peak burn scars, with lower chances farther south. * WHEN...Through 10 PM this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars.
info.instruction: Be ready to act and move to higher ground should a Flash Flood Warning be issued, or flash flooding/debris flows are observed in or near your location.

area.areaDesc: Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet
